quantityRules.description: Pacman frogs are solitary and cannibalistic. House individually only - minimum 10 gallons (10√ó10√ó12 inches).

setupTips: Provide deep substrate (3-4 inches) for burrowing
Keep substrate moist but not waterlogged
Use coconut fiber or sphagnum moss substrate
notes: Terrestrial and sedentary - spends most time buried in substrate
Voracious appetite - will eat anything that fits in mouth
Limited handling recommended - sensitive skin and defensive bite

warnings.message: Can deliver painful bite - handle with caution and avoid hand-feeding
Prone to obesity - do not overfeed. Adults only need feeding every 4-7 days.

feedingRequirements: Carnivorous - crickets, roaches, nightcrawlers, occasional pinky mice
Use feeding tongs to avoid bite
Dust insects with calcium and vitamin supplement
feedingSchedule: Juveniles (0-6 months): Every 2-3 days, appropriately-sized insects
Adults (1 year+): Every 4-7 days, avoid overfeeding
waterNotes: Provide shallow water dish for soaking
Change water daily - frogs often defecate in water
mistingNotes: Mist substrate daily to maintain 60-80% humidity
Keep substrate damp but not soggy
